page.title: 07Grey seals
page.content:
Grey seals are a small part of Lundy's animal population but I find them very interesting creatures and I'm sure you will agree.Here is some information on them.
{GREY SEALS}Over 75% of the world's Grey seals (about 80,000 in 1984) are found in British coastal waters. The majority are found around Scotland because they prefer places that are inaccessible to man.But since Lundy is only inhabited by 17 people, and it has coves unreachable by either land or sea, Grey seals have lived there happily for hundreds of years.
{PUPS}It is estimated that up to 50% of Grey seal pups do not survive their first year.They are battered against rocks and swept off beaches by the rough seas. (continued)
